UTEID: jk34669; jaw4978;
FIRSTNAME: Jinwook; Jesse;
LASTNAME: Kim; Wright;
CSACCOUNT: jk34669; jwright;
EMAIL: jinwook.kim@utexas.edu; jesse.wright@utexas.edu;

[Program 4]
[Description]
There are 3 java files: In Encoder.java, We implemented a lot of print functions, functions that implement entropy, and encoding/decoding functions from the given frequencies. Jesse and Jin have worked together most of the time to write all of the code together. To complie our program, you need to use "javac *.java". To run our program, you need to use "java SecureSystem instructionList"

[Finish]
We have finished the entirety of the project. 

[Test Case 1]

[Command line]
java Encoder frequenciesFile.txt 100

[Input]
9
3
3
1

[Output]
Actual Entropy: 1.6225563
Mapping table (character : encoding)
a : 1
b : 011
c : 00
d : 010
1-Symbol Encoding Efficiency compared to Original: 1.5625
Mapping table (character : encoding)
dd : 1000110
bb : 10011
cc : 10100
aa : 11
ab : 001
cd : 100001
bc : 10101
ac : 000
bd : 1000111
ad : 10110
da : 10111
ca : 011
db : 100010
ba : 010
dc : 100000
cb : 10010
2-Symbol Encoding Efficiency compared to 1-Symbol Efficiency: 1.296875
